first_reading.text:
[[Mi 2,1]]Woe to those who plan iniquity, and work out evil on their couches; In the morning light they accomplish it when it lies within their power.
[[Mi 2,2]]They covet fields, and seize them; houses, and they take them; They cheat an owner of his house, a man of his inheritance.
[[Mi 2,3]]Therefore thus says the LORD: Behold, I am planning against this race an evil from which you shall not withdraw your necks; Nor shall you walk with head high, for it will be a time of evil.
[[Mi 2,4]]On that day a satire shall be sung over you, and there shall be a plaintive chant: "Our ruin is complete, our fields are portioned out among our captors, The fields of my people are measured out, and no one can get them back!"
[[Mi 2,5]]Thus you shall have no one to mark out boundaries by lot in the assembly of the LORD.
first_reading.title: Book of Micah

gospel.text:
[[Mt 12,14]]The Pharisees went out and took counsel against Jesus to put him to death.
[[Mt 12,15]]When Jesus realized this, he withdrew from that place. Many (people) followed him, and he cured them all,
[[Mt 12,16]]but he warned them not to make him known.
[[Mt 12,17]]This was to fulfill what had been spoken through Isaiah the prophet:
[[Mt 12,18]]"Behold, my servant whom I have chosen, my beloved in whom I delight; I shall place my spirit upon him, and he will proclaim justice to the Gentiles.
[[Mt 12,19]]He will not contend or cry out, nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets.
[[Mt 12,20]]A bruised reed he will not break, a smoldering wick he will not quench, until he brings justice to victory.
[[Mt 12,21]]And in his name the Gentiles will hope."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

psalm.text:
[[Ps 10,1]]Why, O LORD, do you stand aloof? 
Why hide in times of distress?
[[Ps 10,2]]Proudly the wicked harass the afflicted, 
who are caught in the devices the wicked have contrived.

[[Ps 10,3]]For the wicked man glories in his greed, 
and the covetous blasphemes, sets the LORD at nought.
[[Ps 10,4]]The wicked man boasts, "He will not avenge it"; 
"There is no God," sums up his thoughts.

[[Ps 10,7]]His mouth is full of cursing, guile and deceit; 
under his tongue are mischief and iniquity.  
[[Ps 10,8]]He lurks in ambush near the villages; 
in hiding he murders the innocent; 
his eyes spy upon the unfortunate.

[[Ps 10,14]]You do see, for you behold misery and sorrow,
taking them in your hands. 
On you the unfortunate man depends; 
of the fatherless you are the helper.
psalm.title: Psalms
